{"step_by_step_thinking": "Metastasis of oral cancer is the process of cancer cells spreading from the primary tumor to distant tissues or organs. To determine the most common route for metastasis of oral cancer, we can analyze the information provided in the relevant documents. Document [0] mentions that metastasis from oral cancer can occur through the lymphatic system or blood vessels. Document [1] states that metastasis to the jaw bones and oral soft tissues can occur from primary organs such as the breast and lungs. Document [4] mentions that metastases to the oral soft tissues can occur, with the gingiva being the most common metastatic site. Based on this information, it can be concluded that the most common route for metastasis of oral cancer is through the lymphatics and blood vessels.", "answer_choice": "B. Lymphatics"}
